fullText: The musical, with a book by Bruce Sussman and songs by Mr. Manilow and Mr. Sussman, tells the story of the Comedian Harmonists, a hugely popular German vocal group whose career was cut short by the rise of the Nazis.

bwwExcerpt: Timely it may sadly be, but a theatrical triumph it still isn’t. I reviewed the show back in 1997, and while it is changed and improved, it rarely rises above a level of admirable, hard-working professionalism. The score, with music by Mr. Manilow and lyrics by Mr. Sussman, is appealingly various—influences range from Gilbert and Sullivan to cantorial melodies to Kurt Weill to standard contemporary Broadway balladry. (There is even a salsa-flavored song that seems to consciously evoke “Copacaban
